title: Font Suggestion
content:
Need a suggestion for typeface. This is a personal logo - I find it very hard to design for myself. I was thinking of something funky, round, sporty. Maybe similar to the Coroflot logo ( [www.coroflot.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905083948/http:/www.coroflot.com/ "www.coroflot.com")). Icon concepts attached.

Thanks for ANY suggestions.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905083948im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/dp-logo_4706.gif)

 [‹ PHP embedding](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905083948/http:/www.typophile.com/node/46680 "Go to previous forum topic") [Retro futuristic / hi-tech font? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905083948/http:/www.typophile.com/node/46700 "Go to next forum topic")
author: dwpear

comments.content: Hi David, what’s the wording that’s going to appear with the icon?

The above two made me think about VAG Rounded or any rounded version of Univers or Helvetica. While the bottom three seem to invite a geometrical font as Futora or Avant Garde (never thought I would recommend those :) or a modern open sans like maybe Scala Sans.

More in ine with your Coroflot-example:  
AddCityBoy or Neuropol

They look like a good match for [Sauna](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905083948/http:/www.underware.nl/) to me. Not that it looks like Coroflot. :-)

Sharon

It’s an icon to appear on self promotion material. Need a font for page personality. I think something with a consistent stroke thickness like Bauhaus, lubalingraph, insignia, …

or maybe helvetica

Thanks for the suggestions.
[Chalet](http://web.archive.org/) came to me right away. Is oblique sporty?
